We can and should learn from history.

I will never feel I have done justice, probably, in expressing the long-concealed truth of rampant sin and abusive patterns in the leadership of "The Lord's Recovery," the Living Stream Ministry, and sadly, in many of the "local churches" - that name being not a general reference to local churches, but to a particular group of believers who consider themselves the ONLY ones in each city meeting "in oneness".....

So here is another attempt to share some of this dear brother's words, which he left for our learning. May his suffering (representing countless others' suffering in this group) and sharing of lessons learned not be in vain.

episodes.title: So much more covered up sin in “The Lord’s Recovery” (Part 2)
episodes.description:
If I could do so efficiently, I would read more sections from Brother Don Hardy's fellowship, reports of his decades serving in the local church with Witness Lee, and of his being mistreated and lied about after confronting gross sexual sins of both Timothy Lee  and Philip Lee. 

The church in Rosemead suffered the loss of a real shepherd when, with no explanation, Don and his family were no longer welcome there, decided by a committee of five; the true explanation would have been helpful for all to know: Don had seen Philip Lee committing an adulterous act in the Living Stream Ministry office, so Philip determined, and had the clout, to get rid of him. Don and his family had to move from the house they were renting - an "LSM"-owned house. His family was extensively damaged. And his story is one of so many similar stories, of lies and abuse of power destroying precious marriages and families.

There is far too much financial corruption, "spiritual" coercion, dishonesty, and sexual impropriety to fit into a Youtube video, and some I, like Don Hardy and all the others, have a hard time even mentioning, it is so defiling.

One verse Brother Don left with us in these 172 pages is: 
Corinthians 11:18–19: “I hear that there are divisions among you. And I believe it in part, for there must be factions among you in order that those who are genuine among you may be recognized.”

Who is genuine? Who is truthful? Who is not hiding evil secrets that have countless victims?

I am one with all believers in Christ, who are one with Christ. But we are never meant to be one with sin and lies and abuse. Don says: "Brother, please know that I am NOT against any ministry which came out o f WL's mouth, from GOD. I receive it (...same as I would from the pope, if he too spoke God's Words, or truth); but I will NOT be a part of WL's and now PL's SINS! Even as they do, we all need to repent of many unconfessed things."  May we all be in the Light, enjoying the Life, in Love.... Correct me if I am wrong, but THIS is being in "the Stream" - the one ministry - the ministry of the Spirit, and being one with THIS ministry, we keep the oneness... of the Spirit. It was never about any certain man, other than Jesus only. 

I refer to this precious document in this video: truestoryofdivisionmaking.com/uploads/3/4/7/1/34712424/rosemeadtrueaccount_1.pdf

episodes.title: So much more covered up sin in “The Lord’s Recovery” (Part 1)
episodes.description: Now I am sharing parts of 172 pages of emails from a dear, faithful servant of Christ who is now with his Master. This brother’s writing is full of love, light, life, and factfulness. I knew many of the facts contained in his emails, but am am still shocked, sickened and heartbroken having read of so much evil covered up in what I believed to be a pure group of Christ followers. Believers deserve to know that corruption pervades the history and present leadership of “The Lord’s Recovery.” We know a tree by its fruit, and when I experienced fruits of the flesh from my own husband, then from his parents, and then from elders and coworkers, I arrived at the realization that I was being presented fleshly acts, from a  whole tree that is full of sexual immorality and impurity, uncleanness, lustful pleasures, lasciviousness, idolatry, hatred, discord, jealousy, fits of rage, selfish ambition, dissensions, factions, envy, drunkenness, indulgence, and the like. Not reproving men - leaders in a Christian community no less - who practice and cover such things is sin. I cannot in good conscience call “The Lord’s Recovery” a group with a long history of covered up sins and lawlessness. We all make mistakes, but righteous people confess, repent, and repair relationships to restore peace with God and with fellow humans. Righteous people who may stray or fail admit the truth and turn from their wicked ways. But I am learning of so many decades of lies and corruption; I’m discovering that the personal tragic undoing of my marriage and the torture I and my adult children still are trying to survive are just samplings of the evil fruit of “this church’s” leadership, practices in direct opposition to God’s Word. More to come, sadly.

episodes.title: “What Would You Say to my Teenage Daughter?”
episodes.description:
A dear brother, who also grew up in the local churches like me, called me yesterday and today, and we had some very precious fellowship about our experiences in the church and in human life. He asked me what I would say to his daughter if she saw my videos, since he is hoping someday she will have a healthy church life. This is my short-version answer to her and to any young adult or teenager who might ask me about what I would recommend, related to the church.

I would clarify or add to what I just recorded that under the point of genuineness - which should be the norm and which little children exemplify…. A church should be a place where everyone can be genuine and is welcomed as they really are, not having to mask things or hide their wounds or their sicknesses. Young adults, teenagers, and anyone else should never have to pretend in order to be accepted in a church. We hear that the church is a hospital. It would not serve a patient well if they were expected to be fine, and had to act like everything is okay with them in a hospital.

I welcome anyone else to share from their experiences, what you would say to a young adult seeking a healthy church life.

episodes.title: Help from "Celebrities for Jesus - How Personas, Platforms & Profits Are Hurting the Church" (1)
episodes.description:
In this video I mainly read parts of the 1st section of this book, "Celebrities for Jesus - How Personas, Platforms, & Profits Are Hurting the Church" by Katelyn Beaty (2022). The celebrity status of certain brothers/families has long troubled some close to me, and is, I believe, a main problem in the current (and historical) troubling situation in "the church," about which I have been speaking out. I mention in this video that Witness Lee and Philip Lee had such a dangerous and damaging celebrity status, but so do my father-in-law and my husband and many other highly regarded leading ones, in the same church community, to varying degrees, but to enough of a degree that what typical people would not get away with, they have, due to identification, "love," admiration, devotion... of many in public, while there is, behind closed doors, anger, abuse of power, cruel treatment of close family members, secrecy, giving in to temptation, and in some cases, addiction.

I failed in this video to read aloud a paragraph (among many paragraphs) about Billy Graham, whom Beaty faithfully critiques regarding his celebrity status, but whose ministry was preserved due to a strict pact he made with his co-workers, the "Modesto Manifesto," to guard against common temptations. She writes (p. 38): "Graham saw with prescient wisdom how intoxicating it would be for leaders to believe they are so important that they can evade accountability they need, even and perhaps especially when their work seems crucial for the kingdom. He saw that celebrity power's central lie is that an individual is important enough to be above the rules. He saw that celebrity so easily leads Christian leaders to use ministry to seek personal riches and thus defy the Bible's many warnings against greed and the love of money. He saw that celebrity causes many leaders to believe that they  can go it alone - that their individual ministries and platforms are more important and central than the  ordinary witness of local churches. And he saw that celebrity entices leaders to fudge the truth...."

So applicable. Thank God for brothers who have cared, and who still care, for what went/goes on behind closed doors, even more than what is seen in public.

episodes.title: A Corroborating Letter Written by Paul Kerr in Feb. 1990, Re: "Response to Recent Accusations"
episodes.description:

In this video, I mainly read a letter written by brother Paul Kerr to K. Robichaux and R. Kangas in February 1990, just 2 months after the publication of the book "A Response to Recent Accusations" - a defaming book aimed at belittling and tearing down a faithful, godly older brother's testimony to the flock under his care of why, after decades as a leading one, as a primary laborer with Witness Lee on the church hymnal and the Recovery Version of the New Testament, he needed to resign from the eldership in Anaheim. 

I am so thankful for all of those who spoke out and especially whose words are in print, who express the same desperate concerns I share, with a heart for the oneness of the unique Body of Christ, which "Body" is NOT equivalent to those who identify as "the Lord's Recovery"/"the local churches", not restricted to adherents of Witness Lee - but comprised of all genuine believers in Christ.

episodes.title: A Public Plea to Ron K. and Kerry R. Related to "A Response to Recent Accusations"
episodes.description: Today I read the book "A Response to Recent Accusations" by Ron Kangas and Kerry Robichaux (Living Stream Ministry, 1989), that, as usual, broke my heart. I want oneness and peace, and I believe so do countless of my brothers and sisters who have reached out for fellowship about deeply offensive and wounding practices, behaviors and words too common among leaders in "the Lord's Recovery." Others desiring peace and oneness have been driven away by the cruel abuse experienced or witnessed in the church, and never spoke out publicly. I know many. And, yes, I put quotes around "the Lord's Recovery", because I don't believe my Lord would treat my brothers and sisters the way they have been and are being treated by many leaders in "the" church, and anything abusive should never be called "Recovery". So I ask you brothers, as you asked John Ingalls at the end of your book: "We invite our brother[s] to treat this matter seriously and to take that proper biblical and human course of action that will produce genuine peace between [themselves] and the Body." Many members of the Body have been and are extremely stumbled by the lack of accountability, the lack of righteousness, justice, and love toward ALL members - without partiality. Instead, there has been falsehood, gaslighting, mockery, sexual misconduct, financial corruption, defaming and despising of believers.... and I am asking that all of this get cleared up through repentance.

episodes.title: Today’s LSM Radio Broadcast About God’s Government Being Just, Righteous and Fair
episodes.description:
The most painful thing to me is loving God’s Word so much, but not seeing it obeyed or lived out - particularly by the teachers of the Word. We should practice what we preach (Matt. 23:3 “…they preach but do not practice.”) 

For the record, for decades I truly saw Dick Taylor live what he spoke in this broadcast, loving and keeping the oneness. 

I’m appealing to all of God’s people, to judge righteously and fairly in any dispute, to care for one another, and not to have differing weights and measures. Rather, let’s have the same love, the same weights and measures for ALL believers. Partiality, favoritism and varied scales and love all divide the Body of Christ.

Let’s keep the ONENESS by keeping, obeying and applying these words that God gave us for the sake of His testimony.

episodes.title: My last video for now
episodes.description:
I think I’ve discharged all that was pressing on my heart, that believers and even the public need to know when encountering “The Lord’s Recovery.” I was a very faithful member. I was an award -winning trainee (that’s another topic…). And I was the victim of multiple instances of abuse. 

I’ve been accused of waiting until the other “parties” died to speak out. I wasn’t ready to speak out and lose (nearly) everything until, due to my marital crisis and the lack of effective help from responsible ones, I lost my church community and nearly everything else anyway. 

Some of my abusers are still alive. I wrote them emails, pleading for fellowship and reconciliation. I’ve been lied about, lied to (and told when I point it out that I’m on the “wrong tree”), stonewalled, my personal female cycle discussed among elders and coworkers with my husband, falsely accused of various mental and emotional disorders… all because I tried to open up lines of communication, to get help, to fulfill my role as the counterpart of my husband in my home…. 

I failed in restoring my marriage, but I was forced to look at the bigger picture, and have found that my marriage is in microcosm of a much bigger system of error.

My email is ruthewise@gmail.com. 

If I spoke publicly about you in any of my videos, please know you are in good company if you are a sinner who repents. You can join all of us who can pray Psalm. 51 together and mean it.

If you are living and living lies, I hope you’d be freed. 

If you think that some are exempt from being accountable because of some position of authority, that’s a big part of the problem. We are all accountable for our sins and for what we witness. 

Silence is complicity.

Love rejoices with the truth.

episodes.title: A Pattern of Using “Godliness as a means to be wealthy” in “The Lord’s Recovery” (Part 2)
episodes.description:
This video focuses on the continuation of corrupt financial practices that began in China with Watchman Nee. Churches in Taiwan and other countries in the Far East suffered similarly, and then the corruption continued in the United States. 

It is a worthy endeavor to support Christian laborers, but there should be righteous handling of finances with transparency and accountability. Financial management and decisions should not be corrupt or illegal nor covered up by teachings related to covering brothers and submitting to deputy authority. 

Some in “the Lord’s Recovery” are excessively wealthy, while others are in dire poverty. Leading brothers typically enjoy significant salaries and comfortable lifestyles, with protection from any accountability under the teaching of “God’s government.” Sadly, the most wealthy in the church seem also to enjoy special treatment, in my observation. And the needy ones, who still hand everything over to the God they live and serve, are blessed if tree from the love of money, but are too often abused while being expected to submit to “authority.” 

And if Christians speak out, related to matters that provoke their conscience, or if it gets too painful and unsustainable for victims of spiritual, marital, and/or financial abuse, believers in this group may appeal to the legal process, and be driven into deep debt or bankruptcy, seeking justice.

episodes.title: An example of elders in “the church” making false accusations and refusing to listen… to a young one
episodes.description:
“Honestly I’d rather be punched in the face than just completely ignored,” my daughter texted me on July 5, 2021. She was being falsely accused by responsible ones in the church in Shoreline, and they refused to meet with her or respond to her… and refused to respond to me, as well, regarding a very serious matter.

Such scenarios are too common in “The Lord’s Recovery.” People are accused and are unwelcome to set any facts straight. They are sometimes excommunicated based on false accusations.

The content in this video is personal but not unique or exceptional. A pattern of ignoring and stonewalling church members who are suffering exacerbates their pain multiple times over. It’s cruel and not what any good shepherd would do to a lamb in need. 

Our young people especially are very vulnerable, as loneliness and isolation are extra dangerous for them.

I sing a song in this video. I am not condoning the words…. I am admitting that I sang this many times to my children, and wishing that “the church” I had known most of my life was/could be  a safe place to those who, as little children, were consecrated to it.

episodes.title: My Personal Marriage Crisis Mirroring the Condition of “The Lord’s Recovery”
episodes.description:
I have been in an intense marriage crisis for about 6 years. It has made me desperate. Every member of our nuclear family through these years has been trying to survive. I have come to realize that there are sadly many parallels between my marital crisis and the condition in the church community in which I was raised. We can’t be one when there is dishonesty and covered up sin. We can’t be one when the main response to pleas for help is the silent treatment. 

God hates divorce, and Jesus prayed that we all may be one… In the light of the truth we have the unifying fellowship, and we confess all our sins and the blood cleanses us… I am pleading that the dishonesty would stop, repentance would be genuine, fellowship would be thorough, and the Lord’s prayer for oneness would be realized.

episodes.title: Reflecting on Experiences in the Church in Seattle and on a couple documents
episodes.description:
Leaving Seattle soon after a week-long visit here, while reflecting on various experiences I had while living here as a child, teenager, and for about 14 months more recently as an adult, and pondering many experiences, observations and written records of dear ones since that time, my heart is bursting with so much truth to speak in love, to anyone to whom such truth could be freeing.

Reading an article from CRI written in 1994 called “Turmoil in the Local Church” makes it clear that even “outsiders” were clear that the “root of the church’s grievance” was related to the failure to deal with Philip Lee’s sinful behavior. Their objective letter is corroborated by all the brothers labeled as “rebellious” in the book The Fermentation of the Present Rebellion. 

That CRI article can be viewed at lcinfo.org/?page=writings/media/turmoil.

Yet in 1993 and again in 1996, elders in the church in Anaheim wrote letters of apology to Phillip Lee. These 9 brothers signed a letter stating that they “do not believe that the public declaration of those three brothers concerning Philip Lee was justified or proper.”

I don’t know of any apology or repentance from Philip. But elders asked him for forgiveness. Did the elders feel to protect sheep being molested by Philip Lee? No one reached out to me for 30 years, though my name was mentioned by a witness as a victim. What is not proper about publicly reproving an elder after receiving reports from multiple witnesses? (1 Tim. 5:20 says,  “￼As for those who persist in sin, rebuke them￼ in the presence of all, so the rest may stand in fear.”) How is rebuking a serial sexual predator in a church not justifiable or proper? How is it “rebellious” to follow God’s Word?

The full apology letter can be found at blendedbody.com/Hongkong/CIA-Letter2PhilipLee.jpg.

episodes.title: Cruelty of Abusing (Deputy) Authority
episodes.description:
Arriving at SeaTac and catching the Light Rail, my heart was saddened to watch a young man in the ground and being constrained by several deputy authorities. I trusted they had reasonable cause to treat my fellow human being that way.

I know many brothers and sisters were, have been, and still are being spiritually treated that way, and worse, by fellow brothers and sisters who represent and enforce “God’s deputy authority.” They are treated that way for expressing their honest concerns about unconscionable treatment of their brothers and sisters. 

If that young man were my brother, and if he were experiencing that treatment for speaking his concerns, I’d broadcast the video far and wide and appeal to people’s consciences to do all we can to not allow such maltreatment of our fellow slaves to continue.

That’s what I’m doing in my videos, as best as I can…

(I apologize if the audio is bad; I’m on the light rail.)

episodes.title: What’s my Point? What’s the Goal?
episodes.description:
I recently read on a forum that my videos kind of all say the same thing, or something like that. Forgive me for any wordiness or repetition. 

What am I hoping for in posting these videos… so feeble and too repetitive and unimpressively simple? 

What have dozens of sincere, devout believers hoped for, who have raised awareness - or tried to- of patterns of sinning in “The Lord’s Recovery” and of the covering up of those sins?

I have heard a highly respected (that in itself being problematic...)"senior co-worker" mocking an older brother who  confronted Brother Lee about some of the gross sins being covered up.  The "senior coworker"  mimicked how that elderly brother said he had to "deeeaal with his conscience" (lowering his voice very deeply like that faithful brother's voice) - making a joke about such a phrase and scorning the brother. Dealing with our conscience is not something to mock. It is essential to keep the oneness and for us to properly love one another - the new commandment, by  which all men know that we are Jesus' disciples.

I hope these videos and my blog (inconvenientruth.com) would join with the voices of many other dear and faithful believers who have not been able to remain silent about intolerable and unreal with sins. Many voices were silenced. Many who’ve spoken out have been publicly shamed and lied about. Such ones face spiritual abuse. Many have lost precious friends and family members due to misrepresentation. 

But silence is not an option once one’s conscience is provoked, when the Lord in us is turning over tables in what should be house of prayer, but has become a den of thieves (Matt. 21:13; Mark 11:17; Luke 19:46). 

The goal of every single video and every single blog I post is “love, which comes from a pure heart and a good conscience and a sincere faith” (1 Tim. 1:5). 

To have healthy love for one another, we need a pure heart and a good conscience and sincere faith. I learned as a little child how to take care of my conscience and it’s something that no believer should ever graduate from. 

I pray that any involved would humble ourselves and pray and seek God’s face and turn from our wicked ways, that God would hear and forgive and heal our land (2 Chron. 7:14).

#lordsrecovery 
#spiritualabuse
#denofrobbers

episodes.title: Humans Are Not Made as Tape Recorders
episodes.description:
Many times in my 20’s, I heard Witness Lee say that we (especially elders and other leading ones) should just be his tape recorders, that they shouldn’t speak anything new - just what Witness Lee has said. In my youth this didn’t sound right. It sounded controlling, diminishing and limiting of all the members of the church, each with their precious portions and experiences and light from God’s Word. 

One may reason such things away, justifying them by various verses like Paul saying to the Philippians that we should all speak the same thing. But he didn’t charge them to say only what he said. I’ve heard the exposition that Paul means we should all speak Christ - the multifaceted, unsearchable, measureless riches of Christ and goodness of God… and we need eternity for that. NOT as tape recorders but as those with a personal knowing and seeing of Christ and all the riches in God’s Word.

To have an attitude that we can only speak with another person, a leader, has spoken can very easily become culty - controlling, and totalitarian, etc.

I am off to meet with believers, but thought I would post this for fellowship among anyone who wants to participate. Thank you.

episodes.title: Noah - or the Emperor with “New Clothes”?
More examples of covering up rather than dealing with sins scripturally in “The Lord’s Recovery”
episodes.description:
Without partiality and favoritism I feel to keep speaking out about multiple cases in which responsible ones in the Local Church and in “The Lord’s Recovery” did not deal properly with sins. These are not victimless sins. They damage the hearts and families of targets and victims. The damage can extend even for generations. The damage doesn’t disappear or heal with silence, but through applying God’s Word faithfully, which involves rebuking and reproving, in the case of leading ones, publicly, and they’re being repentance and forgiveness.

The practice in the Lords recovery has been to publicly rebuke people who speak out, and to quarantine them and label them as poisonous and negative. I am not poisonous or negative. I can’t tolerate these patterns in what is being called “The Lord’s Recovery.” Lives are being destroyed. 

Brothers, what is the motive of stank silent about these improprieties and sins? Is it because of partiality towards certain families? Is it because of financial gain that may be affected if people hold you accountable? 

We live before the Lord. It is better to deal with offenses and sins in this age, while we are still on our way home to meet the Lord.

I’d like to add, related the sexual abuse my daughter experienced from a son of Ben Phillips, Jr.:

1) Brother Ben, when you made that appeal at your dad’s memorial for those who have “left” to “come back” - brother, if we left a particular gathering of believers because we weren’t safe, we weren’t protected by leaders, and we were ignored and/or shamed if we spoke out, how/why would we return to that environment? And I refuse to call such an environment “the” church…. Yes, the church in Corinth had problems, but hopefully they were dealt with properly and thoroughly by leaders. Eventually their testimony faded. Eventually the lampstand was removed from the church in Ephesus. You can have the right name but not be the reality of a church as a lampstand. 

2) I am not speaking about this matter to shame any minors in the church. They need care and shepherding and protection and guidance from the older ones. Both my daughter and this other young person, were suffering, deep depression and family-related pain. They found a lot of solace in being together and talking honestly together. But personal boundaries should always be honored. When my daughter asked for help, help could’ve been given, but her appeals were ignored.

3) To Christy’s grandparents, Willie and Rosalind Wise, she opened to you about her being molested. You told her to not say anything about it, but to cover the family. You should have protected your granddaughter (or any other victim opening to you) - not the image of a high profile family. We should protect every victim of sexual violence, assault, and harassment, without partiality or favoritism.

To all, this is a PATTERN in “The Lord’s Recovery” and it is not sustainable. There needs to be proper rebuking and repenting and forgiveness and restoration in cases such as those I mention in this video.

episodes.title: Serious matters: Contradictions and conflict of interest
episodes.description:

No believer should be above any other believer. Our oneness should not depend on any special affiliation to one particular ministry and the exclusion of others' ministries.

And we should not use godliness as a means for financial gain (1 Tim. 6:5).

If a church ("THE church") is required to have/speak/read only "one ministry," based on one or two brothers' speaking, and a non-profit publishing company is very enmeshed with THE church, financially and practically, and that publishing company sells only those two brothers' writings, there is a huge incentive to silence anything that would cause serious, legitimate and scriptural concerns among followers regarding the publishing company, the churches, and especially leading ones including the "commander" (Elders Training Book 7, 1986, bibleread.online/all-books-by-Watchman-Nee-and-Witness-Lee/book-elders-training-book-07-one-accord-for-the-lords-move-Witness-Lee-read-online/6/).

[From that same Elders Training book just cited, here are 2 pertinent paragraphs I didn't read in the  video:

"Some saints came to me a number of times with reports concerning serious and even negative situations. They may have misunderstood my not responding to them with any kind of seriousness. I believe I did not respond in this way not only out of my patience and toleration but also because of the Lord’s wisdom. I feel that it is altogether wise to be patient. When the fruit of a particular tree is growing, the fruit itself will show what it is. When the fruit becomes ripe, it will fall from the tree. At this point, however, I do not feel that I should tolerate certain situations any longer, because enough damage has been done already. I do not like to see more damage done to the Lord’s recovery. I have no time, dear saints, to fool around with people any longer. Let us go to fight the battle. Who are the “us”? They are the ones who are desperate with no opinion.

and...
"It is altogether not wise for you to remain in the recovery taking this ministry on the one hand and yet on the other hand to say something else. This is not wise. It is not profitable to yourself or to your future. You may say that you have a ministry, but this is not profitable to your ministry if you have one. You can never profit your ministry in the future in this way. Rather, you have dispensed your future in a cheap way. The wise way is to stay, without any opinion, with the recovery, which is unique."]

If there is abuse in THE church and/or in the Ministry office of the publication company, to remain "faithful" in the church and "faithful to the ministry"  - or "one with the ministry"  - seems to require that you look the other way rather than confront and deal with stumbling sin. Such "oneness" of "the Body" is actually a loyalism to a corrupt system/organization with a financial conflict of interest. 

I don't do justice in this video (nor in any video)... but hopefully this is a start.

Add to this the fact that much money is brought in by the activities of the Living Stream Ministry that supports many "faithful to the ministry." What if such ones were to say, "Sin is not acceptable. Sexual harrassment is illegal and should be dealt with seriously." Would they lose their financial support? Would they be shunned?

Oh, wait, this happened. And such ones were labeled "rebellious" and "poisonous" and lied about and excommunicated ("quarantined").

We were cheated from their ministry - which I believe each and every member of Christ's body has.

Our oneness must not depend on oneness with anyone other than the Triune God. If it is, we are very likely in a cult.

episodes.title: Characteristics of Cults for Your Consideration
episodes.description:
Dear viewers of this or any of my videos - Whether or not you are actually in a cult, sharing characteristics with cults should be concerning and should cause anyone to consider their ways. Very trained therapists I have had have said that minimally, I have been treated in cult-like ways over the years... and I know this to be true. I watched "Scientology and Its Aftermath" with tears streaming down my face during some episodes, being able to identify with victims speaking out, or of whom others were speaking. As believers and as doers of God's Word, cult-like behaviors should not be characteristic of our practices.

In this video, I mainly read from a webpage of an international authority on cults, Janja Lalich (janjalalich.com/help/characteristics-associated-with-cults/).

I also make a few feeble comments with a few examples of experiences, practices and observations that align to these characteristics, practiced in "The Lord's Recovery"/"The Local Churches". If I said more, and I have a lot more to say, the video would get too long.

For many, including myself for many years, it is hard to hear these words until/unless you reach a point in your life where destructive treatment directed at you or at someone you love is no longer bearable... then in order to heal, you begin to face the facts and to think soberly and, yes, critically, about your community, your choices (or lack thereof), the consequences of your choices, and how all of that compares to the characteristics of cults.
